intro: Seseli hippomarathrum subsp. hebecarpum, commonly known as the narrow-fruit seseli, is a flowering plant belonging to the Apiaceae family. It is characterized by its slender, upright stems and small, greenish-yellow flowers arranged in umbels. The subspecies is distinguished by its narrow, elongated fruits, which are typically less than 5 millimeters in diameter. It is native to regions of southern Europe and is often found in dry, rocky habitats. The plant is of interest to botanists due to its unique morphology and limited distribution.
